channel.title: Giving a VScrollBar to a Frame/Form in VB6
channel.description:
So the question is. How do you give a Frame (Group Box in .NET) or a Form in VB6 a vertical scroll bar. so that i could scroll down if needed.
I have tried loads of things. but i have never used Scroll Bars before so don't know much about them.

item.title: Giving a VScrollBar to a Frame/Form in VB6
item.dc:creator: @usernamelol .Fusion
item.description:
@usernamelol wrote:

Oh sorry ill find out give me a minute.

Read full topic
item.source: Giving a VScrollBar to a Frame/Form in VB6

item.title: Giving a VScrollBar to a Frame/Form in VB6
item.dc:creator: @Texasmd91 Texasmd91
item.description:
@Texasmd91 wrote:

[quote=“usernamelol, post:2, topic:51094”][quote author=fisser link=topic=67455.msg781171#msg781171 date=1168988561]
if you make a textbox you have right of the screen thing like ginving it a name ect you have to select multiline and vbschollbar then you have a txt box with scrollbars
[/quote][/quote]
im looking on to how to add scrollbars to frames and not textboxes.

adding scrollbars to txtbox is pretty much common-sence

Read full topic
item.source: Giving a VScrollBar to a Frame/Form in VB6

item.title: Giving a VScrollBar to a Frame/Form in VB6
item.dc:creator: @usernamelol .Fusion
item.description:
@usernamelol wrote:

[Help] How do I use VScrollBars properly in Visual Basic 6.0

if you make a textbox you have right of the screen thing like ginving it a name ect you have to select multiline and vbschollbar then you have a txt box with scrollbars

Read full topic
item.source: Giving a VScrollBar to a Frame/Form in VB6
